definitions.definition: the act of working with another person or group of people to create or produce something
definitions.sensetop: collaboration with somebody (on something)in collaboration with somebodyin collaboration with somebody on somethingcollaboration between A and B

examples.text: It was a collaboration that produced extremely useful results.
The new plane was a triumph of European industrial and technical collaboration.
the results of a fruitful collaboration with the industry
She wrote the book in collaboration with one of her students.
The government worked in close collaboration with teachers on the new curriculum.
examples.contextForm: in collaboration with somebody on something

examples.text: collaboration between the teachers and the government
The project is designed to foster collaboration between the university and industry.
a collaboration by experts in various fields

definitions.definition: a piece of work produced by two or more people or groups of people working together
definitions.sensetop: collaboration with somebody/somethingcollaboration between A and B

examples.text: The exhibition is a collaboration with the Australian Centre for the Moving Image.
This mission was a collaboration between the National Space Development Agency of Japan and NASA.

definitions.definition: the act of helping the enemy during a war when they have taken control of your country

examples.text: his wartime collaboration with the Nazis

wordOrigin: mid 19th cent.: from Latin collaboratio(n-), from collaborare ‘work together’.
